After the final battle, Signalman is reverted from his Ranger Key form into his normal form and he, along with Doggie Kruger, salutes to the Gokaigers as a sign of thanks.

 is actually a Lemurian Precious called The Golden Sword that can assume human form. Though a Precious, Zubaan is allowed to fight alongside the Boukengers against the Negative Syndicates. Zubaan later appears during the Legend War, as seen in "199 Hero Great Battle", to battle numerous Gormin and Zugormin, alongside the other Super Sentai supporting warriors.

, who also does the voice of the narrator and the Gokaigers' weaponry, plays the voice role of Zubaan in "199 Hero Great Battle", as well as voicing Kirenger and Red Falcon in that same film.

 used to be an arrogant rebel before he joined the Shinkengers as to fight against the Gedoushu. He appears in the "199 Hero Great Battle" film along with Genta.

 was a sushi vendor, and an old friend of Takeru Shiba, who joined the Shinkengers to battle the Gedoushu as . He appears in the "199 Hero Great Battle" film along with Chiaki.

, nicknamed the "Sweet Angel," was chosen by Engine Bearrv to fight against the Gaiark as of the Go-ongers. She appears in the "199 Hero Great Battle" film and enables the Gokaigers to access the Great Power of the Go-ongers. She later reappears in "The Flying Ghost Ship" film when she, alongside her fellow G3 Princess members Miu and Kegalesia, distracts Baseball Mask to help the Gokaigers (as the Gorengers) defeat him.

 is a treasure hunter who works for the Search Guard Successor (SGS) Foundation and leads the Boukengers as to find relics known as the "Precious" and lock them away from multiple factions that can use those powers for destruction. During the events of the "199 Hero Great Battle" film, Satoru gives the Gokaigers his acceptance in them gaining the Boukenger Keys' Great Power. He later appears in episode 21 of the television series to ask the Gokaigers to help him collect a Precious known as the , which the remnants of the Jaryuu Clan have used to resurrect their former leader Ryuuwon. After getting the Heart of Hades back, he questions whether what the Gokaigers are doing was what Aka Red wanted.

 is a circus acrobat who was possibly a descendant of the Denzi People and battled the Vader Clan as , eventually defeating them and Demon King Banriki before he and his teammates founded a sports camp in memory of their friend IC. He and his team later joined the other Super Sentai teams in destroying the first Zangyack invasion force. Soon after, he becomes a traveling anpan vendor for elementary schools. During the events of "199 Hero Great Battle", after meeting a boy with a well-preserved DaiDenzin toy, Daigoro meets Ryo and Umeko as they help out a laid-off salaryman. Later, he grants the Gokaigers the ability to access the Great Power of the Denzimen. Daigoro makes his return in "".

 who became the Dairangers' to fight the Gorma Tribe while learning of his Dai Tribe heritage. After defeating Shadam, the newly crowned Gorma Emperor, Ryo achieved his dream of becoming a great gyoza cook prior to him and his team battling the Zangyack 1st invasion force alongside the other Super Sentai. During the events of "199 Hero Great Battle", Ryo meets Daigoro and Umeko as they help out an out-of-work salaryman and later grants the Gokaigers the ability to access the Great Power of the Dairangers. Ryo later helps Gai, after losing his Gokai Cellular, in realizing that he doesn't need to have powers to protect people and to never forget the most important part about being a hero.

, affectionately called by her teammates, is an officer of Dekarangers serving as . She appears in the "199 Hero Great Battle" film where she was driving with Murphy, before almost running over an unemployed salaryman crossing the street and she meets Daigoro and Ryo, who decide to help out the salaryman who has a well-preserved Variblune toy.

 was a chess club president and a janitor who joined the Future Science Laboratory to fight the menace of the Dark Science Empire Desdark as of the Goggle-V team. He appears in the "199 Hero Great Battle" film granting the Gokaigers the ability to access the Great Power of the Goggle-V team.

 was a fencer who fought the Tailed-People Clan Jashinka Empire as of the Dynamen. She appears in the "199 Hero Great Battle" film granting the Gokaigers the ability to access the Great Power of the Dynamen.

 was a pilot who was showered with Bio Particles to battle against the Neo Empire Gear as of the Biomen. He appears in the "199 Hero Great Battle" film granting the Gokaigers the ability to access the Great Power of the Biomen. He also has a cameo in Super Hero Taisen via voice over which urges on Gokai Silver to defeat his old enemy.

 was a baseball team captain in his high school days who acquired Seelon's magic and Doctor Dazai's science to fight against the Bōma Hundred Tribes as of the Turborangers. He appears in the "199 Hero Great Battle" film granting the Gokaigers the ability to access the Great Power of the Turborangers.

 is an elementary school student who is Alata's good friend and the Goseigers' ally in their adventures by allowing them to live with him and his father at the Amachi Institute. Being the exception in the Gosei Angels' policy of erasing peoples' memories of them, Nozomu played a role in helping the Goseigers and becoming a better person in the process. Nozomu appears in "199 Hero Great Battle", witnessing the Goseigers and the Gokaigers battling the Black Cross Colossus as he rallies the frighten citizens of Tokyo into believing in the power of Super Sentai.

 was a brilliant doctor who was bored with his life until the Evoliens came to Earth. Delighting in the chaos, Mikoto found the egg of the Burstosaur known as Top Galer and the Dino Minder, using them to fight the Abarangers as . The Dino Minder, however, was unstable and eventually resulted in Mikoto's death after he had a change of heart and started to help the Abarangers prior to their final battle. Along with the ghosts of Burai (Dragon Ranger) and Naoto Takizawa (Time Fire), Dr. Nakadai plays a part in Gai Ikari becoming Gokai Silver and giving him the Great Powers of the Abarangers, Zyurangers, and Timerangers.

 is a resident of the Ginga Forest with power over fire who assumed the title of to honor his brother to fight the Space Pirates Barban alongside his Starbeast partner Ginga Leon. Even though the Gokaigers are space pirates as well, he accepts them as a Super Sentai team.

 is Ryouma's older brother. Originally meant to be Ginga Red, a series of events lead to Hyuuga inheriting the powers of the Black Knight Bull Black to become the new to battle the Barban with his Starbeast partner Goutaurus. Upon meeting the Gokaigers, being pursued by Basco, Hyuuga tests Gai's self-worth as a Gokaiger. When Gai passes his test, Hyuuga entrusts him with both the Black Knight Key and the Great Power of the Gingamen.

 is the youngest of the Tatsumi siblings who supported her brothers as against the Psyma Family. Luka and Ahim find her after hearing Navi's hint of "an act of mercy" while she is working as an EMT. After witnessing their fight against Basco Ta Jolokia, she entrusts them with the GoGoFive team's Great Power.

, nicknamed the "Lovely Sensation," is a rich girl with a princess attitude who was chosen by Engine Jetras to fight against the Gaiark as of the Go-on Wings. She appears in "The Flying Ghost Ship" film alongside her fellow members of G3 Princess to distract Baseball Mask to make Gokaigers (as Gorengers) win. After the fall of the Zangyack Empire, Miu later appears to receive her Ranger Key and her team's Great Power back from the Gokaigers as she expresses her gratitude to the crew.

, composed of , , and are a trio of students from the Hayate Way's Ninja Academy who saved the world from the Space-Ninja Group Jakanja before they graduated into full-fledged ninja. Sensing the sons of two of their greatest enemies within Zangyack's ranks, the Hurricanegers appear before Gai, Ahim, and Doc to regain their Ranger Keys. After they fought with the Gokaigers against Satarakura, Jr. as the Hurricanegers, they gave back their Ranger Keys along with their Great Power which is used to destroy Satarakura, Jr.

Nanami appeared in Boukenger Vs. Super Sentai were Abare Black, Deka Break, Magi Yellow, Magi Shine and Bouken Silver.

, , and reprise their roles as Yousuke Shiina, Nanami Nono, and Kouta Bitou, respectively.

 was a loner who was hit by Birdonic Waves and was drafted soon after as of the Jetmen to battle the Vyram while dealing with his own feelings for his teammate Kaori Rokumeikan, a.k.a. White Swan. After the fall of Vyram, Gai was mortally wounded while on his way to give his blessings to Kaori being married to his rival Ryu Tendoh, the team leader Red Hawk, before he died. Years later, playing cards with God in the Golden Gate bar, Gai briefly returns to the land of the living to help the Gokaigers obtain the Great Power of the Jetmen keys so his teammates would not be endangered.

 was a chiropractor who was chosen by the Burstosaur Triceratops to become and fight with him against the Evoliens. After the Evoliens are defeated and the Burstosaurs return to Dino Earth, Sanjyo resumed his work as a chiropractor full-time and eventually married his secretary Emiri. He later assists the Gokaigers in attaining his part of the Great Power of the Abarangers.

 was a high school student when the Burstosaurs came to earth and answered their call to fight alongside them. However, her body is not able to become an Abaranger and thus aids the team as their support. During a few occasions, Emiri assumed the identity of her own version of an Abaranger called . After the Abarangers' adventures ended, Emiri remained working at Dino Curry until she was hired by Yukito to become his secretary and they eventually married. When they meet the Gokaigers, she provides Ahim with an Abare Pink Key, much to Gai's surprise and to Ahim's dismay at the resultant transformation.

 was at the bottom of the class at Academia Island before he became the Livemen's to fight against Volt, who manipulated their friends into becoming the organization's leading scientists. Though Joh managed to save his friend Goh Omura (Dr. Oblar) and convince him to leave Volt, he and his team were unable to do the same for Kenji Tsukigata (Dr. Kemp) and Rui Senda (Dr. Mazenda) as they both died because of Volt's leader Doctor Bias. After Doctor Bias was defeated, Joh resolved to become a professor so history would never repeat itself. While the Gokaigers look for his team, Joh appears rescuing a baby with Joe, and even helps rescue a boxer who was almost kidnapped by Action Commander Zaien, who drops a device with blueprints for a model of Barizorg. Joh takes Joe back to his lab to see if there is a way to reverse the process, only to find that the process was irreversible. Despite this discovery, and indirectly revealing being a part of Liveman, he tells Joe of his personal experience with Volt's scientists to give him the drive to defeat Barizorg in order to save his friend's soul while giving him his team's Great Power.

Captain is an ace pilot and team leader of UAOH who became to fight the Baranoia Empire. He sends Momo Maruo to give the Gokaigers their team's Great Power to them while he distracts Basco after being contacted by someone from the Earth Defense Force about another Great Power being stolen. The distraction fails, but the Gokaigers come to stop Basco. They are soundly defeated, but Goro tells them that if they need to unite their powers, then they should use his teams's Great Power to do it.

First Lieutenant is the youngest of the Ohrangers who uses Chinese boxing and aikido. Momo became to also fight the Baranoia Empire. After hearing about another Great Power being stolen, she is sent by Goro Hoshino to distract the Gokaigers, then give them their team's Great Power. However, the Gokaigers refuse, stating that they'd rather earn the Great Power themselves using their own means, rather than being handed a Great Power.

, nicknamed the "Speed King," is a former racer with a sunny disposition who became to aid his Engine partner Speedor in the fight against the Gaiark. He hitches a ride with the Gokaigers to Gunman World to help the Engines, only to be barred from getting back to Human World by Babatcheed. The Gokaigers, Sōsuke, and the Engines then decide to go to Machine World to convince Machalcon to help them.

 is a pink radar robot created by Engine Jum-bowhale from the Machine World, who supported the Go-ongers by creating their arsenal and performing maintenance on the Engines. He lands on the Gokai Galleon asking for the Gokaigers assistance and eventually reunites with Sōsuke.

, , and are Go-on Red, Go-on Blue, and Go-on Yellow's respective partners and denizens of Machine World. They battled Chirakashizky in Gunman World, only to have their power taken away and shrunk down to their Engine Cast size. They are reunited with Sōsuke, and Speedor and Bearrv reveal that they got married and had a child, Machalcon, who they never see much of since they are battling evil.

, , and reprise their voice roles as Speedor, Bus-on, and Bearrv, respectively.

 was originally a slacking senior at Moroboshi High School who was chosen to become the Megarangers' after winning an arcade game that was actually an INET recruitment device. With his classmates, Kenta battled the forces of Nejirejia under Doctor Hinelar before finally defeating him on the day of their graduation despite the villain's attempt to make them outcasts by exposing their secret identities. After helping the Gingamen in their final battle with the Barban, Kenta becomes a teacher at Moroboshi High prior to him and his team joining the fight against the Zangyack's first invasion force. Meeting the Gokaigers, Kenta offers to give them his team's Great Power if they become students for a day. He watches their progress from afar, when he is lured into the woods by Sally and is threatened by Basco with bombs placed all over the school, which he will detonate, unless he hands over his team's Great Power. Thankfully, Gai intervenes until the other Gokaigers join the fray, after they took care of the bombs. At the end of the day, he gives the Gokaigers his team's Great Power, as promised.

 is a womanizer who had been a professional grappler who was banned from professional fighting for never being on time for a match because he would chase after girls. As a member of the TPD, Domon became of the Timerangers to capture Don Dolnero and the Londers prisoners. In the process, he and the others altered events in the present that changed his time that he was only suspended from the ring for a year. Once stopping Gien from destroying the present, Domon returns to his time unaware that his girlfriend Honami Moriyama, whom he revealed his true identity to, bore him a child. But when he sends the Gokaigers to , to avert the destruction of a shrine by the Matrintis Empire, Domon learns of his son's existence by chance.

 is a reporter and photographer, not only daring enough to take photographs of the Londers Family but to also uncover the Timerangers' true identities before deciding to back off. Eventually, Honami fell in love with Domon as the two begin dating. However, after Domon is forced to return to his time once the present was saved, Honami is revealed to bore him a son, Mirai.

 is Domon and Honami's son in the present that Honami never told Domon about. In "Timeranger", he was only shown at the end of the series as an infant referred by Tatsuya Asami, Time Red, as "Domon, Jr".

Mirai Moriyama is portrayed by .

 was a member of Japan's National Defense Ministry, a wild child who can talk to animals. Along with three other National Defense Agents and an investigator from the FBI, Shiro battled the Secret Society Egos as of Battle Fever J. With his pet panda on his side, Shiro, disguised as Santa Claus, gives the Gokaigers the Great Power of the Battle Fever J team as a "present" for saving Christmas. Shiro makes his return in "".

As he did with Daigoro Oume in "199 Hero Great Battle", reprises his role as Shiro Akebono as well as Daigoro and Retsu Ichijouji from "Space Sheriff Gavan" at the same time in "Gokaiger vs. Gavan".

 is a pupil of the Three Shinshou who was sealed away into a blue pot after being fooled by the evil Daimaou of the Youkai Army Corps into attacking people centuries ago. He was released by Tsuruhime in 1994 and assisted the Kakurangers in their modern fight against the Youkai Army Corps before parting ways with them alongside his mentors. However, Ninjaman's reckless attempt to save a girl from rampaging zoo animals, causing massive property damage and bodily harm to said animals in the process, forced the Shinshou to seal him once more and place his container at the Negakure Shrine so he can think about his actions over a decade. As a result, Ninjaman did not participate in the Legend War and was freed almost two years later by the Gokaigers as they need the Kakurangers' Great Power, realizing that he must be the one to give it to them due to Domon having them go to the past to save the Negakure Shrine from Metal-A's actions. After being updated of what happened in his absence and their mission, influenced by his personal experience with helping others, Ninjaman refuses to give the Gokaigers' his team's Great Power until he tests them to see if they are worthy of it. After Gai and Doc released Action Commander Juju's exorcism by themselves, Ninjaman gives the Gokaigers the Great Power of the Kakurangers which is revealed to be Ninjaman himself by using the Kakuranger Ranger Keys to summon him into a giant form to aid the Gokaigers in defeating Action Commander Juju. Afterwards, he bids the Gokaigers farewell before vowing to help them in the future.

 was the twenty-fourth protector of the Seal Door and the youngest team leader of the Kakurangers who fought the Youkai Army Corps as . She was the one who released Ninjaman to assist her team in the modern fight against the Youkai. She also used to be one of the members of Punishment Sisters. Years later, Tsuruhime sights the Gokai Galleon at night. Originally, she was going to meet the Gokaigers personally, but instead, she learns that the Gokaigers have Ninjaman to help them fight against the Zangyack, so she decides to leave the rest to Ninjaman before she leaves.

 is a practitioner of the style who enjoys being commentator for the giant battles. Originally, he was a companion of Mere after she ate him while she was alive and thus was dependent on her Rinki to survive. However, he becomes able to survive on his own due to the bit of Genki she absorbed from Long coursing in him. Bae is drafted to SCRTC after his companion's death. After Long was sealed by Gekirangers, he ended up with Gou Fukami before they got separated in India, with Bae later returning to Japan in time for commentary on the giant battle between Go-ongers, Gekirangers and Long Banki. Bae makes his return in "Gokaiger vs. Gavan", where he is jailed inside the small cage that Yatsudenwani carried before he is being rescued by the Gokaigers.

 was a Trinoid who once fought the Abarangers, becoming Mikoto's servant before helping the Abarangers. Working in Dino House as their battle with the Evoliens came to an end, Yatsudenwani became the president of Dino House during the events of "Tokusou Sentai Dekaranger vs. Abaranger" when business got good. Yatsudenwani makes his return in "Gokaiger vs. Gavan" where he is being jailed in the Makuu Prison while carrying the cages of Bae and Gekkou. He has developed a crush on Luka and Ahim shortly before he is being released by the Gokaigers. Yatsudenwani will make his return in "".

 was a colleague of Ryusuke Ohwashi, who was the first Vul Eagle, and master of kendo who joined the Guardians of World Peace to fight the Machine Empire Black Magma as of the Sun Vulcan team, after Ohwashi left to pursue space shuttle research for NASA. After Basco's demise, Hiba appears to the Gokaigers, granting the Gokaigers the ability to access the Great Power of Sun Vulcan. After the fall of the Zangyack Empire, Hiba appears to receive his Ranger Key and his teams Great Power back from the Gokaigers and he salutes the crew as a sign of thanks.

 was a Japanese Army Ranger and a narcissistic womanizer who joined Earth Defense Force to battle the Great Star League Gozma as of the Changemen. Years later, Basco stole the Great Power of Changemen from the Earth Defense Force. Then Hayate later contacted Goro Hoshino of the United Airforce Overtech Hardware to alert him of Basco's actions. After Basco's demise, Hayate appears to the Gokaigers, granting the crew the ability to access the Great Power of Changemen.

 was abducted when he was just a child to be used as a guinea pig by the Reconstructive Experiment Empire Mess, but was rescued by the people of Planet Flash along with four other children. Raised on the rocky Green Star, he developed great physical strength and returned with his friends to Earth to fight as to stop Mess from conquering it. After Basco's demise, Dai appears to the Gokaigers and grants the crew the ability to access the Great Power of Flashmen.

 was a Chinese boxer and a straight sword expert who was trained by Commander Sanjuro Sugata to obtain the Aura Power as of the Maskmen to battle the menace of the Underground Empire Tube. After Basco's demise, Akira appears to the Gokaigers and grants the crew the ability to access the Great Power of Maskmen.

 was a music teacher who specialized in kung fu, the twin sister of Fumiya, known as Five Black, and the youngest of the Hoshikawa siblings who fought the Silver Imperial Army Zone as of the Fivemen. After Basco's demise, Remi appears to the Gokaigers and grants the crew the ability to access the Great Power of Fivemen. After the final battle against the Zangyack, Remi receives her Ranger Key and her team's Great Power back from the Gokaigers and she expresses her gratitude to the crew.

 was the Knight of the Sharma Tribe who fought the menace of the Bandora Gang as of the Zyurangers. Prior to the final battle against the Zangyack, Goushi later appears to Gai to advise him that Gai and his teammates should not worry about what will happen to himself and the other past Super Sentai warriors that the Gokaigers have already met should the crew have to use the Greatest Treasure in the Universe. After the final battle against the Zangyack, Goushi later appears to receive his Ranger Key and his team's Great Power back from the Gokaigers and he expresses his gratitude to the crew.

 is an amateur astronomer who runs the Amachi Institute, is Nozomu's father, and the only present parent. He hired the Goseigers as part-time workers, unaware of their actions. Regardless, Shuichirou aids them on certain occasions and eventually learned the truth about the Gosei Angels from Master Head after agreeing to be his medium to talk through due to being of pure heart. Shuichirou is later seen by Joe and Doc helping the innocent victims prior to the final battle against the Zangyack.

 was a classmate of Kai on whom he developed a strong crush. When she was kidnapped by Hades Beastman Berserker Glúm do Bridon to be his bride, Kai as Magi Red saved her, and she realized that Kai and Magi Red were one and the same. Yuka is later seen by Joe and Doc comforting the victims and giving a Magi Red plush doll (which she had made as a lucky charm when she was a teenager) to a child prior to the final battle against the Zangyack.

 is the oldest daughter of the Ozu family who fought together with her Magiranger family against the Infershia as . After the fall of Zangyack, Houka later appears to thank the Gokaigers for having her Ranger Key and her team's Great Power back from them.

 is the third son of the Tatsumi family and a helicopter pilot in the Central City Fire Department Aviation Department who fought with his siblings against the menace of the Psyma Family as . After the fall of the Zangyack Empire, Shou later appears receiving his Ranger Key and his team's Great Power from the Gokaigers and he salutes them as a sign of thanks.

 was a member of a bōsōzoku gang who dreamed of becoming a world boxing champion. He fought the menace of the Gorma Tribe as of the Dairangers. After the fall of Zangyack Empire, Shoji, along with Kazu, appears to thank the Gokaigers when he receives his Ranger Key and his team's Great Power back from the crew.

 was a stylish beautician and a dancer who fought the Gorma Tribe as of the Dairangers. After the fall of Zangyack Empire, Kazu, along with Shoji, appears to thank the Gokaigers when he receives his Ranger Key and his team's Great Power back from the crew.

In addition to the various new characters introduced in "Kaizoku Sentai Gokaiger" that serve as the antagonists, several antagonists from prior series appear as well. While some of the antagonists have made an alliance with the Zangyack, there are others who have their own agenda to battle against the Gokaigers and other past Sentai members. However, some of them who have changed from their old ways appear to interact with the Gokaigers and past protagonists as well.

 was originally the , the leader of the Black Cross Army organization who was defeated by the Gorengers, who capitalized on his vulnerability to the cosmic rays of the constellation Cassiopeia, several years ago. During the events of "Gokaiger Goseiger Super Sentai 199 Hero Great Battle", he reincarnates using the hatred of defeated Super Sentai villains and forms an alliance with Zangyack in order to have his revenge on all Sentai and those who support them. He also revives several of the Sentai warriors' enemies, Brajira, Yogoshimacritein, and Dagon, to battle against the Gokaigers and Goseigers. He gets his hands on the Ranger Keys and uses it to turn the Super Sentai into his personal army. After the Ranger Keys were recovered, he grew into a giant, only to be defeated by the Super Sentai Bazooka. After being defeated however, he reveals his true form as the and resurrects several of the past villains. He is ultimately destroyed by Goren Gokaioh's Gokai Hurricane Cassiopeia. Black Cross King makes his return as a member of Dai-Zangyack, headed by Emperor Marvelous, in "".

Black Cross King is voiced by .

 was the rogue Gosei Angel who manipulated various groups to battle the Goseigers. His scheme was put to end when the Goseigers stopped the wedges which was filled with his remaining Dark Gosei powers that would activate the Nega End. He is revived as a member of the Black Cross Army during the events of "Gokaiger Goseiger Super Sentai 199 Hero Great Battle" as he also takes on the title . He battles Gokai Red and Gosei Red in his own dimension but he's defeated by the combined efforts of Gokai Red and Gosei Red. Brajira is shown to summon phantoms of all his previously assumed forms to fight against all of the previous Sentai's giant robots. Brajira and all of his summoned forms are ultimately destroyed by the combined finishers of Gokaioh and Gosei Great and the rest of the Sentai's giant robots. Brajira makes his return as a member of Dai-Zangyack, under the leadership of Emperor Marvelous, in "".

 was the leader of the Gaiark's Human World invasion force and the father of Land Pollution Minister Yogostein, who fell in the Gaiark's final battle with the Go-ongers in the Human World. He is revived as a member of the Black Cross Army and takes on the title during the events of "Gokaiger Goseiger Super Sentai 199 Hero Great Battle". He fights against Gokai Yellow, Gokai Blue, Gosei Black and Gosei Yellow but he's defeated by their combined powers. Later he's resurrected by Black Cross King in the giant battle and he summons the phantoms of Gaiark members Chirakasonne and Kireizky. He is destroyed by Engine-Oh, Dairenoh, and RV Robo.

 is Yogoshimacritein's right-hand man who was defeated by the Go-ongers. He is revived and summoned as a member of the Black Cross Army in the giant battle during the events of "Gokaiger Goseiger Super Sentai 199 Hero Great Battle". He is defeated by the combined efforts of Abarenoh, Galaxy Mega, and Daizyuzin.

 is one of Gaiark's ministers who was defeated by the Go-ongers. He is revived and summoned as a member of the Black Cross Army in the giant battle during the events of "Gokaiger Goseiger Super Sentai 199 Hero Great Battle". He is destroyed by Victory Robo, Goggle Robo, and Sun Vulcan Robo.

 was the seemingly invincible leader of the Hades Gods that battled the Magirangers, his undying faith in the Infershian deity N Ma led to his eventual death at the hands of Hades Goddess Sphinx. He is revived as a member of the Black Cross Army and takes on the title during the events of "Gokaiger Goseiger Super Sentai 199 Hero Great Battle". He battles Gokai Green, Gokai Pink, Gosei Blue and Gosei Pink but he's defeated by their combined efforts. He's resurrected by Black Cross King in the giant battle and summons the phantoms of Hades Gods Ifrit and Cyclops. He met his end at the hands of Magi King, Gingaioh, and Five Robo. Dagon makes his return as a member of Dai-Zangyack, under the leadership of Emperor Marvelous, in "".

 was one of the members of the Infershia Pantheon who died fighting the Magirangers. He is revived and summoned as a member of the Black Cross Army during the events of "Gokaiger Goseiger Super Sentai 199 Hero Great Battle". He is destroyed by Dyna Robo, Flash King, DaiBouken, and Battle Fever Robo.

 is one of the members of the Infershia Pantheon who died fighting the Magirangers. He is revived and summoned as a member of the Black Cross Army during the events of "Gokaiger Goseiger Super Sentai 199 Hero Great Battle". He is destroyed by Dekaranger Robo, Live Robo, and Turbo Robo.

Previously the leader of the Jyaryu Clan, was an enemy of the SGS Foundation and its Boukengers until he died when the SGS Foundation's Precious Bank self-destructed five years ago. He is revived in a half-rotted state through the power of the Precious known as the , gaining its power and using it against his old foe Satoru Akashi and the Gokaigers when they and the Zangyack raced to find it. Marvelous is able to retrieve the Heart of Hades from Ryuuwon, but the loss of the power source causes Ryuuwon to go berserk and enlarge himself, only to be defeated by Gokaioh using the Great Power of the Boukengers.

 is a baseball-themed member of the Black Cross Army who was destroyed by the Gorengers when they exploited his inability to hit changeups and executed the Goranger Hurricane Change-Up attack. Baseball Mask is revived to serve Los Dark during the events of "Kaizoku Sentai Gokaiger the Movie: The Flying Ghost Ship", as he challenges the Gokaigers in a baseball match. He is defeated by the Gokaigers as the Gorengers with the Goranger Hurricane Ball, using an image of G3 Princess to divert his attention on the third strike. Baseball Mask takes his defeat with grace before he explodes.

 is an arms dealer from Planet Rain who supplied various alien criminals while setting up his own scheme to eliminate the Dekarangers. However, Abrella's scheme fails and he meets his end at the hands of the Dekarangers. In "Kaizoku Sentai Gokaiger the Movie: The Flying Ghost Ship", the Gokaigers wind up in a dimension where Abrella has his Mechanoid army attack them while stating the futility of them endlessly fighting back against an army of thousands. On a gambit, the other Gokaigers battle Abrella and the Mechanoids while Captain Marvelous takes the God's Eye from Los Dark and uses it to bring his shipmates back to the land of the living.

 was the former of the villainous Gaiark Clan who fought the Go-ongers. She, along with Kitaneidas, were heavily damaged by Yogoshimacritein after they destroyed the Infinite Wastebin and gave the Go-ongers the location of Deus Haguru Magear before shutting down. In "", Kegalesia, along with Kitaneidas and Yogostein, were dragged from the bottom of the Sanzu River by Batcheed to cooperate with his plan but she declines as she points the location of the Batchrium Plant on the moon to Shinken Gold, who later tells this information to his team and the Go-ongers. In "", she is imprisoned along with her fellow ministers in the Makuu Prison before she is released by the Gokaigers. Kegalesia is also involved in a "love triangle" with Doc and Shizuka while in prison. Kegalesia's G3 Princess form is used by the Gokaigers when they use the Gorenger Keys to distract Baseball Mask.

 is the Gedoushu's strategist, a squid-headed demon armed with a shakujō who awaited for Doukoku's revival. During the climatic battle of the Goseigers and the Shinkengers, he gathered an army of followers to kill Buredoran and reclaim the Sanzu River. However, Shitari ends up facing the Gokaigers and is destroyed by Gokai Red as Go-on Red.

 is Robogorg's personal attendant and the marshal of the Matrintis Empire who is the first high spec Matroid built by her master to serve him. Prior to her and her master battling the Goseigers, Metal-A encounters the Gokaigers while they used the Timerangers' Great Power to arrive into the past as she was about to have Negakure Shrine destroyed to obtain the power within it. Though wanting to gather intel on them, Metal-A decides not to pursue the Gokaigers and instead modify the Zan-KT specs in preparation for the Goseigers.

 is the wise owl-like leader of Dark Shadow who was originally the head of the Society of Shadow, sacrificing himself to defeat the Demon Bird by fusing into its body to separate its soul from it while ending up in his current style. As the leader of Dark Shadow, he sent his servants to obtain relics called Precious for the highest bidder. The organization remains active after the series ended as Gekkou appears as a cameo in the ending of "Juken Sentai Gekiranger vs. Boukenger".  is a Dark Shadow kunoichi who carries the task of obtaining Precious and embarking in business affairs.  was one of the Gaiark ministers who fought the Go-ongers. Acting on his own to avenge his vice minister Hiramechimedes, Yogostein met his end at the hands of Go-on Red. , the self-titled Queen of the vampires, was a spy for Infershia who fought the Magirangers. , also known as , was the leader of Warstar, an intergalactic armada used by Buredoran of the Comet in his agenda against the Goseigers.  is the military leader of the Yuumajuu and Makuin's right hand in their scheme to turn Earth into a polluted world for their kind to flourish. Tokusou Sentai Dekaranger is a 2004–2005 Japanese children's television series in the Super Sentai series.
In an iteration of the planet Earth when extraterrestrial contact has been made, the Dekaranger force battles the criminal syndicate of Alienizer.

is a police force who make sure that all aliens abide by intergalactic laws, and has advanced extraterrestrial technology at its disposal, giving its officers suits made out of Deka Metal that make them Dekarangers.
